messages.title: Dear Sam
messages.content: I promise this one has some new elements in it.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposes leaving the EU, supports remaining and protecting the success of Cambridge as a vibrant university city with rights of EU nationals.
Against the mass change automation will bring to society, wants proper funding for NHS.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Difficulties with the Lib Dems in the past, tactical situation regarding forgiving them for past actions.

issues.brexitEurope: Supporting EU membership, highlighting the dangers of a hard Brexit.
issues.education: Concerned about education funding, referencing personal experiences.
issues.environment: Past involvement with Greenpeace, campaigned about climate issues.
issues.health: Supports NHS strongly against any form of privatization and automation changes.
issues.immigration: Wants to protect rights of EU nationals.
issues.socialWelfare: Wants proper funding for NHS and to address social care, criticizes zero hour contracts.

housing.content: Concerned about zero hours contracts, sky-high rents and short term job contracts.

leaflet.personalStatement: Dedicated to the area, mentioning local and personal connections and consistency in views over time.

politicalExperience.achievements: Campaigning on various local and national issues.

contactInformation.address: Alex Wood Hall, Norfolk Street, Cambridge, CB1 2LD

images.caption: Daniel Zeichner out and about in Cambridge.

leaflet.additionalNotes: References personal stories and commitment to community, also speaks about international concerns such as President Trump visits to UK and frustration over Brexit.
